Package edu.harvard.data.io

This package contains reader and writer utilities that parse data records from various sources.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    JsonDocumentParser
    Interface required by the JsonFileIterator class to extract all DataTable records that are contained in a JSON document.
    TableReader<T extends DataTable>
    Marker interface for class that sequentially reads the records of a data set.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CombinedTableIterator<T extends DataTable>
    Iterator class that combines the records returned by multiple existing TableReader instances.
    CombinedTableReader<T extends DataTable>
    Implementation of the TableReader interface that iterates over the records returned by multiple other table readers.
    DelimitedFileIterator<T extends DataTable>
    Helper class that implements an iterator over comma, tab or otherwise delimited data files.
    FileTableReader<T extends DataTable>
    TableReader implementation that reads records from a delimited data file.
    HdfsDelimitedFileIterator<T extends DataTable>
    Helper class that iterates over a data file stored on the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS).
    HdfsTableReader<T extends DataTable>
    Implementation of the TableReader interface that reads records from a file stored on the Hadoop Distributed File System.
    JsonFileIterator
    Iterator that reads JSON-formated data from a local file.
    JsonFileReader
    Stream class that parses an InputStream or local File containing JSON-formatted records.
    S3TableReader<T extends DataTable>
    TableReader implementation that reads records from a delimited data file.
    TableWriter<T extends DataTable>
    Output stream that writes a series of DataTable records to an OutputStream or to a local file.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    IterationException
    Runtime wrapper class for checked exceptions thrown inside iterators that implement the Iterable interface.

Package edu.harvard.data.io Description

This package contains reader and writer utilities that parse data records from various sources. Data IO is modeled as iterators on top of streams. Since the data sets that will be parsed by this package are likely to be too large to store in memory, iterators allow client code to process the records line-by-line, maintaining a manageable memory footprint. The main interface in this package is TableReader. This is a marker interface that defines a data source; a TableReader represents an iterator that will sequentially read the records of a DataTable. Implementations of this interface handle the details of fetching and reading the data. Clients of this package should be aware that different data sources can generate different exceptions, and so should be aware of the context where these interfaces are used. While there are multiple TableReader implementations, there is only a single TableWriter. The TableWriter outputs DataTable records to an OutputStream or to a local file which, once closed, can be moved elsewhere in the infrastructure by client code. While the majority of the classes in this package are based around reading tabular data, the JsonFileReader enables clients to parse JSON-formatted data. The JsonFileReader class consumes a data file formatted as newline-delimited JSON objects, and then uses an instance of JsonDocumentParser to convert those objects to DataTable records. Clients of the code need to provide a custom JsonDocumentParser, but do not have to handle the details of parsing JSON.
